metadata.title: Footprints in the cotton fields: The Industrial Revolution as time space appropriation and -environmental load displacement

relevance.relevance: The study examines the displacement of labor and land due to the Industrial Revolution, focusing on the British textile industry and its global impacts.

design.sample_characteristics: Focus on British textile industry and its global trade relations in the mid-19th century.

dependent_variables.displaced: The study quantifies the displacement of labor and land due to the British textile industry's reliance on imports.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Period of industrial expansion and global trade in the 19th century.
historical_context.institutional_context: Colonial trade policies and economic relations between Britain and its colonies.

outcomes.main_findings: The study finds significant displacement of labor and land due to the British textile industry's reliance on imported raw materials, highlighting unequal exchange and environmental load displacement.
outcomes.conclusions: The Industrial Revolution involved significant appropriation of global labor and land resources, contributing to technological and economic disparities.
